channel.title: Lapwarmer Gamer- Looking for External Video Card
channel.description:
Basically, I'm running a laptop so getting a new video card to put INSIDE of the computer is out of the question because I'm not even going to attempt to remove the solder that is keeping the video card attached to the motherboard. I've looked for external video cards but I can't find any that are affordable, can do what I want or made it out of development.
Processor: AMD Athlon 64 X2 Dual-Core Processor TK-53 1.70GHz
Video Card: ATI Radeon X1200
RAM: 1918MB
HDD: 250GB
Current Video Card Problems: -Can't even run DirectX10 -Doesn't have Vertex Shaders -basically just shit
What I want: -Ability to run DirectX10 decent -Ability to run DirectX9- smoothly -Not expensive -External
PS: I looked at the AMD XMG but apparently that wasn't going to have a large enough market so its production was stopped :mad: I also looked and some other thing called firewire or something but it cost $1,500 and at that point, I immediately clicked the X in the corner of the tab.
Thanks to anybody that can help.

item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Lol removing the solder…its funny that you think that even if you managed to do this it would be possible to replace it with another chipset.

Read full topic

item.title: Lapwarmer Gamer- Looking for External Video Card
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Unhandled:

then you are shit out of luck because your graphics card is not upgradable.

[s]I don’t know if I’m quite ready to accept that as the answer.

I’ve been reading about externals & am currently reading more and more about them but do you know anything about externals? As in: Do they actually work? If yes, are there compatability issues with any hardware I have? If no, is there anyone working on it currently?[/s]

EDIT: I believe you, anybody have a guide on building an affordable rig that also is mid-high end.

Read full topic
